posts.name: sharrington9614
posts.cooked: My and the other mentors on the team have been going back and forth for over two weeks on what the best laptop spec is for a new driver station laptop. We all agree that since the driver station code is fairly lightweight it doesn‚Äôt have to be super powerful. Our biggest concern is that USB Hubs and Ethernet to USB-c adaptors can be flaky and we don‚Äôt want to lose a match because a cable connection on the driver station flaked out on us. So I figured id ask the community what they look for as the ideal spec for a driver station laptop

posts.name: Travis Weir
posts.cooked: As per many threads on here before, used Latitudes are the way to go. They‚Äôre often built better than consumer grade machines, have nice things like built in Ethernet ports, and can easily be found for a fraction of their new cost.

posts.name: Ken Schenke
posts.cooked:
I don‚Äôt think the FRC Driver Station application is lightweight at all, especially when you paired with Shuffleboard or Smart Dashboard.  Add live streaming from your robot and the laptop is handling quite a bit.

I personally recommend a gaming laptop, though not necessarily current-gen.  I agree with your desire to use a dedicated Ethernet port as well as a laptop with enough USB ports for all controllers.  This is one reason why a gaming laptop is better.  They tend to still have Ethernet and several USB-A ports.  FIRST has a Best Practices page here:

This document was created by Steve Peterson, with contributions from Juan Chong, James Cole-Henry, Rick Kosbab, Greg McKaskle, Chris Picone, Chris Roadfeldt, Joe Ross, and Ryan Sjostrand. The origi...

posts.name: sharrington9614
posts.cooked: Thanks, I couldn‚Äôt find many recent threads describing this issue, so I figured id poll the community to see if the group consensus had changed

posts.name: E L
posts.cooked: We have Lenovo ThinkPads from like 2015 or something and they work just fine, we don‚Äôt normally run any external apps on them except for shuffleboard, drive station, smartdashboard, labview, and maybe onshape in browser if need be Obvoiusly, get something newer than 2015, but a ThinkPad or a gaming laptop is the way to go

posts.name: MrRoboSteve
posts.cooked: The driver‚Äôs station guidance really hasn‚Äôt changed the last couple of years. Any 2018 or 2019 or newer thinkpad or latitude is going to work just fine unless you have really demanding requirements on the client.
